title: How to Make Vegan Mole

steps.headline: Place the ancho chiles, pasilla chiles and raisins in a heatproof bowl.
steps.description: Cover the chiles and raisins with the boiling water. Allow the mixture to soak for 1 hour.

steps.headline: Heat the canola oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic to the oil, stirring to make sure that the vegetables are coated in the oil.
steps.description: Cover the skillet and cook the vegetables for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour the chile mixture and its soaking liquid into a blender or food processor.
Puree the mixture until it is smooth.
Add the cooked onions and garlic in oil to the blender or food processor.
Add the tomatoes, peanuts, tortilla chips, vinegar, cinnamon, coriander and cloves to the blender or food processor.
Puree all of the ingredients until they produce a smooth paste.
Transfer the paste to a medium saucepan, scraping the sides of the blender pitcher or food processor bowl with a flat plastic spatula.
Add the vegetable broth and the chocolate to the saucepan.
Cook the mixture, stirring it occasionally with a wooden spoon, over low heat.
steps.description: You want the sauce to simmer, not to boil.

steps.headline: Taste the sauce and add salt as needed.
Serve the sauce or store it in an airtight container.

text: Place the ancho chiles, pasilla chiles and raisins in a heatproof bowl. Cover the chiles and raisins with the boiling water. Allow the mixture to soak for 1 hour. Heat the canola oil in a skillet over medium heat.  Add the onion and garlic to the oil, stirring to make sure that the vegetables are coated in the oil. Cover the skillet and cook the vegetables for 5 minutes. Pour the chile mixture and its soaking liquid into a blender or food processor.  Puree the mixture until it is smooth.  Add the cooked onions and garlic in oil to the blender or food processor.  Add the tomatoes, peanuts, tortilla chips, vinegar, cinnamon, coriander and cloves to the blender or food processor.  Puree all of the ingredients until they produce a smooth paste.  Transfer the paste to a medium saucepan, scraping the sides of the blender pitcher or food processor bowl with a flat plastic spatula.  Add the vegetable broth and the chocolate to the saucepan.  Cook the mixture, stirring it occasionally with a wooden spoon, over low heat. You want the sauce to simmer, not to boil. Taste the sauce and add salt as needed.  Serve the sauce or store it in an airtight container.
